pullRequest.body:
Subsequent PRs will prove properties of this definition, and implement the `rw_search` tactic using it.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5858949285/job/15883952790)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5859472813/job/15885546222)

This won't compile against master due to auto implicit.

bors cancel
bors d+

:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Canceled.

> This won't compile against master due to auto implicit.

I pushed the four character fix, but wonder if the offending lemma should exist at all (see my comment above).
@semorrison, it looks like you ran a rebase with the wrong arguments; can you revert the last few commits and try again?

It was an automatic rebase, no arguments from me! :-) In any case, I'd already merged this branch up into all the dependent PRs before seeing this, so I think it's done now. I'll happily share the credit!
bors merge

bors seems to be confused on this one.

bors r-
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  Build succeeded!

  The publicly hosted instance of bors-ng is deprecated and will go away soon.

  If you want to self-host your own instance, [instructions are here][instructions].
  For more help, visit [the forum].

  If you want to switch to GitHub's built-in merge queue, visit [their help page][gh].

  [instructions]: https://github.com/bors-ng/bors-ng#how-to-set-up-your-own-real-instance
  [the forum]: https://forum.bors.tech
  [gh]: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/configuring-branches-and-merges-in-your-repository/configuring-pull-request-merges/managing-a-merge-queue



  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5874534093/job/15929438224)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5874534093/job/15929438126)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5874534093/job/15929438332)

I'm confused about the name here (and below).
```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2023 Scott Morrison. All rights reserved.
```
Are your PR-ing on someone else's behalf?
If this is correct (and not a pseudonym/alias), then probably the PR description should gain a Co-authored-by line

I think this is worth the extra lines for clarity:
```suggestion
def defaultCost [DecidableEq α] : Cost α α ℕ where
  delete _ := 1
  insert _ := 1
  substitute a b := if a = b then 0 else 1
```
I think `@[simps]` can generate these
Indeed!

Why `Σ'` and not
```suggestion
    (xs : List α) (y : β) (d : {r : List δ // 0 < r.length}) : {r : List δ // 0 < r.length} :=
```
Can you make the type of `w` explicit here? (and below)

Should these be in a separate test file? Should we have a style guide that gives an opinion on this?

(no need to un-bors the PR, we can clean this type of thing up another time)

What's going on here? Why  not state it as
```suggestion
-- This is only used in keeping track of estimates.
theorem suffixLevenshtein_eq (xs : List α) (y ys) :
    impl C xs y (suffixLevenshtein C xs ys) = suffixLevenshtein C xs (y :: ys) := by
  rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: computation of Levenshtein edit distance

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: lower bounds for Levenshtein edit distance
[Merged by Bors] - feat: Estimator typeclass and implementation for Levenshtein distance
